definition: variant of 模擬|模拟[mo2 ni3]
to imitate/to copy
to plan to/to draft (a plan)/to imitate/to assess/to compare/pseudo-
doubtful/suspicious/variant of 擬|拟[ni3]/to emulate/to imitate

sentences.english: Mimic operation was performed on one side of fresh specimen.
sentences.chinese: 一侧新鲜标本上，摹拟术式设计。

sentences.english: I couldn't speak Chinese, but I showed in mime that I wanted a drink.
sentences.chinese: 我不会讲汉语，但我作摹拟动作表示要一杯饮料。

sentences.english: The actor was miming the movements of a bird.
sentences.chinese: 这位演员正在摹拟一只鸟的动作。

sentences.english: This simulation program is available for use at universities.
sentences.chinese: 这种摹拟程序适合在大学里施用。

sentences.english: The mimic operation of compound flap of distally based pedicled were designed on another 4 samples.
sentences.chinese: 另用4侧标本行远端蒂复合瓣摹拟手术。

sentences.english: However, he does not support parody but advocates the natural balance of all the lines instead.
sentences.chinese: 但他并不主张摹拟，而是力求诗句的自然匀稳。

sentences.english: The imitate operation was designed on 4 specimens.
sentences.chinese: 另在4侧标本上摹拟手术设计。

definition: variant of 模仿[mo2 fang3]
to trace over/to copy (a calligraphy model)/facsimile/(fig.) to depict/to portray
to bear a close resemblance to/to be the very image of
to describe
commonly seen
brief but comprehensive/compendious
to follow old patterns/to imitate existing models/to continue along the same lines
variant of 摹寫|摹写[mo2 xie3]
assiduous and painstaking
to imitate to perfection/to be remarkably true to life
word/phrase/(old) (grammar) function word/predicate
variant of 敷衍/to elaborate (on a theme)/to expound (the meaning of the classics)
variant of 簡練|简练[jian3 lian4]
technique of writing/calligraphy/or drawing
modulation (rising and falling pitch)/intonation/a cadence/to rise and fall (of a body floating in water)
purport/intent
